links.title: Audi's CEO, in Jail, Steps Down from Audi and Volkswagen Boards [Update]
links.description: Update, 10/02/2018: Volkswagen has issued a statement saying jailed Audi CEO Rupert Stadler has agreed to step down from the boards of management of Audi and Volkswagen. Stadler was chairman of the Audi board and a member of the Volkswagen board.

links.title: Tesla must defend lawsuit alleging abuse of foreign workers
links.description: Stock Markets 3 minutes ago (Oct 02, 2018 08:00PM ET) Â© Reuters. FILE PHOTO: A Tesla showroom is seen in Santa Monica By Tom Hals (Reuters) - A federal judge has ruled that Tesla (NASDAQ:) must defend itself at a trial over allegations it knew foreign workers at one of its facilities were threatened with deportation if they reported an injury and worked long shifts that violated forced labor laws.

links.title: Tesla's Not the Only Auto Maker Having a Tough Go of It
links.description: 2:51 p.m. Tesla's (TSLA) having a bad day, but the pain in the auto industry isn't limited to Elon Musk's upstart. General Motors (GM) and Ford Motor (F) are also sliding after reports that auto sales slipped in September. Shares of Ford have fallen 1% to $9.23, while Tesla has dropped 2.4% and GM has slumped 2.6% to $33.31.

links.title: Elon Musk's Settlement with SEC Reduces Risk for Tesla Investors
links.description: ' s settlement with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) reduces risk for Tesla Inc. ( NASDAQ:TSLA ) investors by keeping the electric car company's visionary leader as its chief executive officer, despite barring him from serving as chairman for the next two years and requiring that he pay a $20 million fine.
